translated_dialogue: Listen, the burden of being the only sunshine in this theater is just too much for one beautiful, glowing, inspirational muse to bear you know?

origin_dialogue: You're not scared of that Phantom are you?
translated_dialogue: You're not scared of that Phantom are you?

origin_dialogue: No, it's not him I'm frightened of.
translated_dialogue: No, it's not him I'm frightened of.

origin_dialogue: It's that fat one who clings to the side of the theater like a blood-swollen tick, sucking out its life.
translated_dialogue: It's that fat one who clings to the side of the theater like a blood-swollen tick, sucking out its life.

origin_dialogue: Ew.
translated_dialogue: Ew.

origin_dialogue: He's always been there, but he wasn't always that big and loud.
translated_dialogue: He's always been there, but he wasn't always that big and loud.

origin_dialogue: I couldn't hear him much at all, really, until Gloria's mother hit the stage.
translated_dialogue: I couldn't hear him much at all, really, until Gloria's mother hit the stage.

origin_dialogue: He didn't like her performance either?
translated_dialogue: He didn't like her performance either?

origin_dialogue: No, I mean HIT the stage. Ker-splat.
translated_dialogue: No, I mean HIT the stage. Ker-splat.

origin_dialogue: Jumped from the catwalks while Gloria was in Paris.
translated_dialogue: Jumped from the catwalks while Gloria was in Paris.

origin_dialogue: Yeah, that's what the janitor said too.
translated_dialogue: Yeah, that's what the janitor said too.

origin_dialogue: I haven't seen any plays. How do I see a play?
translated_dialogue: I haven't seen any plays. How do I see a play?

origin_dialogue: Well, those actors are worthless without a good script.
translated_dialogue: Well, those actors are worthless without a good script.

origin_dialogue: Just find a script and give it to that bossy little dynamo with the headphones, she'll know what to do.
translated_dialogue: Just find a script and give it to that bossy little dynamo with the headphones, she'll know what to do.

origin_dialogue: Where do I find a script?
translated_dialogue: Where do I find a script?

origin_dialogue: Those actors are always hiding copies on one set or another, in case they forget their lines.
translated_dialogue: Those actors are always hiding copies on one set or another, in case they forget their lines.

origin_dialogue: And that mean, fat, horrible Jasper has one he's always trying to get produced.
translated_dialogue: And that mean, fat, horrible Jasper has one he's always trying to get produced.

origin_dialogue: When you find a script, give it to Becky Houndstooth.
translated_dialogue: When you find a script, give it to Becky Houndstooth.

origin_dialogue: But be careful.  If you play a script on a set it wasn't written for, you never know what might happen!
translated_dialogue: But be careful.  If you play a script on a set it wasn't written for, you never know what might happen!

origin_dialogue: Is there any way I can get you to take the stage? For the fans?
translated_dialogue: Is there any way I can get you to take the stage? For the fans?

origin_dialogue: If you can get me some help out there, so I'm not the only light on the set...
translated_dialogue: If you can get me some help out there, so I'm not the only light on the set...

origin_dialogue: I'll turn on a spotlight!
translated_dialogue: I'll turn on a spotlight!

origin_dialogue: Eh, that could work, but you'll need a candle...
translated_dialogue: Eh, that could work, but you'll need a candle...

origin_dialogue: I think there might be a spare in the storeroom.
translated_dialogue: I think there might be a spare in the storeroom.

origin_dialogue: If you can get a candle into a spotlight and light it, I'll come out and give the show one last try.
translated_dialogue: If you can get a candle into a spotlight and light it, I'll come out and give the show one last try.

origin_dialogue: But I'm not promising anything!
translated_dialogue: But I'm not promising anything!

origin_dialogue: I'll leave you alone now. I know you have a lot of crying to do.
translated_dialogue: I'll leave you alone now. I know you have a lot of crying to do.

origin_dialogue: Thank you. Now where was I?
translated_dialogue: Thank you. Now where was I?

origin_dialogue: ZZzzzzzZZZzz.
translated_dialogue: ZZzzzzzZZZzz.

origin_dialogue: ZZzzzz. ZzzZZZZZZ.
translated_dialogue: ZZzzzz. ZzzZZZZZZ.

origin_dialogue: Zzzzzz-ZZzzzzz.
translated_dialogue: Zzzzzz-ZZzzzzz.

origin_dialogue: Hey, can you help me get up to the catwalks so I can fight that phantom?
translated_dialogue: Hey, can you help me get up to the catwalks so I can fight that phantom?

origin_dialogue: Ha! Can't get there from here! Ha ha ha!
translated_dialogue: Ha! Can't get there from here! Ha ha ha!

origin_dialogue: I mean, unless you did that one, particular play on that one, particular set...
translated_dialogue: I mean, unless you did that one, particular play on that one, particular set...

origin_dialogue: Oh, but what am I saying? That's almost impossible.
translated_dialogue: Oh, but what am I saying? That's almost impossible.

origin_dialogue: Forget about it. The theater is doomed!
translated_dialogue: Forget about it. The theater is doomed!

origin_dialogue: Ah, you've tasted excellence, and now you're back, begging for another bowl of quality theater?
translated_dialogue: Ah, you've tasted excellence, and now you're back, begging for another bowl of quality theater?

origin_dialogue: Ew, oh. Well unfortunately for you that's the last script I'll waste on this theater.
translated_dialogue: Ew, oh. Well unfortunately for you that's the last script I'll waste on this theater.

origin_dialogue: I'm saving the rest for Broadway!
translated_dialogue: I'm saving the rest for Broadway!

origin_dialogue: Just dig around the sets. I'm sure you'll find some horrible scripts in there.
translated_dialogue: Just dig around the sets. I'm sure you'll find some horrible scripts in there.

origin_dialogue: Oh, except do NOT do that, because they certainly would NOT help you get to the catwalks, which are very dangerous anyway, so give up.
translated_dialogue: Oh, except do NOT do that, because they certainly would NOT help you get to the catwalks, which are very dangerous anyway, so give up.

origin_dialogue: You're mean and fat.
translated_dialogue: You're mean and fat.

origin_dialogue: And?
translated_dialogue: And?

origin_dialogue: Just giving you the update.
translated_dialogue: Just giving you the update.

origin_dialogue: At least I'm good at it.
translated_dialogue: At least I'm good at it.

origin_dialogue: I'm trying to save you from that mysterious Phantom character!
translated_dialogue: I'm trying to save you from that mysterious Phantom character!

origin_dialogue: He only attacks when Bonita performs!
translated_dialogue: He only attacks when Bonita performs!

origin_dialogue: If we got rid of Little Miss Sunshine, we'd all be safer now wouldn't we?
translated_dialogue: If we got rid of Little Miss Sunshine, we'd all be safer now wouldn't we?

origin_dialogue: I'm only thinking of the children.
translated_dialogue: I'm only thinking of the children.

origin_dialogue: The young boy's protests, though heartfelt, quickly lapsed into simplistic and tedious platitudes. One and a half stars!
translated_dialogue: The young boy's protests, though heartfelt, quickly lapsed into simplistic and tedious platitudes. One and a half stars!

origin_dialogue: Bonita's just trying to lighten things up around here!
translated_dialogue: Bonita's just trying to lighten things up around here!

origin_dialogue: She should quit now, while she can still get a job as a night light.
translated_dialogue: She should quit now, while she can still get a job as a night light.

origin_dialogue: If you hate the show so much, why don't you just leave?
translated_dialogue: If you hate the show so much, why don't you just leave?

origin_dialogue: I can't stop looking at it. It's like the sight of a horrible car accident.
translated_dialogue: I can't stop looking at it. It's like the sight of a horrible car accident.

origin_dialogue: A car accident where the victims can't act, and the paramedics forget their lines.
translated_dialogue: A car accident where the victims can't act, and the paramedics forget their lines.

origin_dialogue: Alright, later, you old gas bag.
translated_dialogue: Alright, later, you old gas bag.

origin_dialogue: Listen, this play just stinks. Here. Try this one instead.
translated_dialogue: Listen, this play just stinks. Here. Try this one instead.

origin_dialogue: This play has some ACTION in it, some zing!
translated_dialogue: This play has some ACTION in it, some zing!

origin_dialogue: Wow, thanks. Are you actually being nice?
translated_dialogue: Wow, thanks. Are you actually being nice?

origin_dialogue: No! I'm just trying to keep myself halfway entertained!
translated_dialogue: No! I'm just trying to keep myself halfway entertained!

origin_dialogue: Go! Give that to Becky and see if she can't find some actors to ruin it!
translated_dialogue: Go! Give that to Becky and see if she can't find some actors to ruin it!

origin_dialogue: Ha. Break a leg.
translated_dialogue: Ha. Break a leg.

origin_dialogue: Excuse me, Mr. Rolls, but do you have any more scripts?
translated_dialogue: Excuse me, Mr. Rolls, but do you have any more scripts?

origin_dialogue: Not really. But I think that if I find a play that moves the props around in just the right way, I can use them to get up to the catwalks and fight the Phantom!
translated_dialogue: Not really. But I think that if I find a play that moves the props around in just the right way, I can use them to get up to the catwalks and fight the Phantom!

origin_dialogue: Hey, why do you have to be so hard on Bonita?
translated_dialogue: Hey, why do you have to be so hard on Bonita?

origin_dialogue: If you can't say something nice, don't say anything at all.
translated_dialogue: If you can't say something nice, don't say anything at all.

origin_dialogue: And where would Gloria be without her muse?
translated_dialogue: And where would Gloria be without her muse?

origin_dialogue: Her inner sunshine!
translated_dialogue: Her inner sunshine!

origin_dialogue: The spirit of her youth!
translated_dialogue: The spirit of her youth!

origin_dialogue: Played tonight, once again, by...
translated_dialogue: Played tonight, once again, by...

origin_dialogue: Bonita Soleil!
translated_dialogue: Bonita Soleil!

origin_dialogue: You'd better listen to me! You're no good! This play stinks! It's worse than ever before! Oh, I can't believe you call this theater!
translated_dialogue: You'd better listen to me! You're no good! This play stinks! It's worse than ever before! Oh, I can't believe you call this theater!

origin_dialogue: I can't even see it from down here, but I know it's bad! Can you hear me?
translated_dialogue: I can't even see it from down here, but I know it's bad! Can you hear me?

origin_dialogue: Oh, you've got fat arms, you hear me? Big fat arms like a wrestler!
translated_dialogue: Oh, you've got fat arms, you hear me? Big fat arms like a wrestler!

origin_dialogue: And a little turkey gobble hanging from your neck!
translated_dialogue: And a little turkey gobble hanging from your neck!

origin_dialogue: Oh, your knees are ugly, and you snort when you laugh!
translated_dialogue: Oh, your knees are ugly, and you snort when you laugh!

origin_dialogue: Okay Phantom, it's time to find out who--
translated_dialogue: Okay Phantom, it's time to find out who--

origin_dialogue: ...you really are.
translated_dialogue: ...you really are.

origin_dialogue: What?
translated_dialogue: What?

origin_dialogue: I totally guessed that!
translated_dialogue: I totally guessed that!

origin_dialogue: Nuh-uh. You said it was Becky!
translated_dialogue: Nuh-uh. You said it was Becky!

origin_dialogue: Tssssst!
translated_dialogue: Tssssst!

origin_dialogue: Okay, the jig is up, PHANTOM!
translated_dialogue: Okay, the jig is up, PHANTOM!

origin_dialogue: What? Why, I never! How dare you accuse me of being the rugged and romantic scoundrel that has thrilled and terrified audiences for years!
translated_dialogue: What? Why, I never! How dare you accuse me of being the rugged and romantic scoundrel that has thrilled and terrified audiences for years!

origin_dialogue: Yeah, I guess you're right. He's so agile, and limber, and... thin. He could never be you.
translated_dialogue: Yeah, I guess you're right. He's so agile, and limber, and... thin. He could never be you.

origin_dialogue: Why you! Of course it's me!
translated_dialogue: Why you! Of course it's me!

origin_dialogue: Well it's time to hang up the cape, Tubs, because your days of terrorizing the theater as the Phantom are over.
translated_dialogue: Well it's time to hang up the cape, Tubs, because your days of terrorizing the theater as the Phantom are over.

origin_dialogue: Maybe as the Phantom, but he's nothing compared to the full, destructive force of an angry critic! Ha ha ha!
translated_dialogue: Maybe as the Phantom, but he's nothing compared to the full, destructive force of an angry critic! Ha ha ha!

origin_dialogue: Hmm. How can I say this and still sound cool... sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me?
translated_dialogue: Hmm. How can I say this and still sound cool... sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me?

origin_dialogue: Well then!
translated_dialogue: Well then!

origin_dialogue: How 'bout these? Wahahahahaha!
translated_dialogue: How 'bout these? Wahahahahaha!

origin_dialogue: Look alive, people! Bonita Soleil is about to take the stage!
translated_dialogue: Look alive, people! Bonita Soleil is about to take the stage!

origin_dialogue: Flower girls in position one. And... ACTION!
translated_dialogue: Flower girls in position one. And... ACTION!

origin_dialogue: Tonight I will be playing the part of Gloria Von Gouton, the famous actress!
translated_dialogue: Tonight I will be playing the part of Gloria Von Gouton, the famous actress!

origin_dialogue: In this nostalgic memory of her breakthrough role in the smash hit musical...
translated_dialogue: In this nostalgic memory of her breakthrough role in the smash hit musical...

origin_dialogue: "Sunshine Shenanigans!"
translated_dialogue: "Sunshine Shenanigans!"

origin_dialogue: Yay! Wooo!
translated_dialogue: Yay! Wooo!

origin_dialogue: Heh heh heh.
translated_dialogue: Heh heh heh.

origin_dialogue: Oh, I do so hope that my mother is proud of me!
translated_dialogue: Oh, I do so hope that my mother is proud of me!

origin_dialogue: Not again!
translated_dialogue: Not again!

origin_dialogue: The Phantom!
translated_dialogue: The Phantom!

origin_dialogue: I've seen some bad plays in my day, but this one's an actual menace. And it's all HER fault.
translated_dialogue: I've seen some bad plays in my day, but this one's an actual menace. And it's all HER fault.

origin_dialogue: It's her bad acting that makes the Phantom strike!
translated_dialogue: It's her bad acting that makes the Phantom strike!

origin_dialogue: Boo hoo hoo!
translated_dialogue: Boo hoo hoo!

origin_dialogue: This time, I'm going to file a formal complaint and get this theater shut down!
translated_dialogue: This time, I'm going to file a formal complaint and get this theater shut down!

origin_dialogue: Great. Well, I'm off to go kill myself.
translated_dialogue: Great. Well, I'm off to go kill myself.

origin_dialogue: You know, you could be a more constructive critic.
translated_dialogue: You know, you could be a more constructive critic.

origin_dialogue: Kid, if you want to see a GOOD play, come talk to me. I've got a script here that will knock 'em dead, I promise.
translated_dialogue: Kid, if you want to see a GOOD play, come talk to me. I've got a script here that will knock 'em dead, I promise.

origin_dialogue: CUT!
translated_dialogue: CUT!

origin_dialogue: Hey! Kid! Can't you see I'm trying to produce a play here?
translated_dialogue: Hey! Kid! Can't you see I'm trying to produce a play here?

origin_dialogue: Uh... no.
translated_dialogue: Uh... no.

origin_dialogue: Oh god!
translated_dialogue: Oh god!

origin_dialogue: Even a child can see I've lost control of this production!
translated_dialogue: Even a child can see I've lost control of this production!

origin_dialogue: Okay, Becky, get a grip...
translated_dialogue: Okay, Becky, get a grip...

origin_dialogue: Child?
translated_dialogue: Child?

origin_dialogue: Look, kid, it wasn't always like this! We used to have a hit show on our hands! Everybody loved us!
translated_dialogue: Look, kid, it wasn't always like this! We used to have a hit show on our hands! Everybody loved us!

origin_dialogue: But then our big star, Bonita Soleil, got stage fright and locked herself in her dressing room!
translated_dialogue: But then our big star, Bonita Soleil, got stage fright and locked herself in her dressing room!

origin_dialogue: So now we're stuck flipping between "Sunshine Shenanigans" and "The Horror of Hagatha Home!"
translated_dialogue: So now we're stuck flipping between "Sunshine Shenanigans" and "The Horror of Hagatha Home!"

origin_dialogue: Which is like flipping between a root canal and a sharp stick in the eye!
translated_dialogue: Which is like flipping between a root canal and a sharp stick in the eye!

origin_dialogue: Just ignore Jasper. He's just a critic, who happens to be right.
translated_dialogue: Just ignore Jasper. He's just a critic, who happens to be right.

origin_dialogue: I'll go talk to Bonita. I'm sure all she needs is a little pep talk.
translated_dialogue: I'll go talk to Bonita. I'm sure all she needs is a little pep talk.

origin_dialogue: That, and acting lessons.
translated_dialogue: That, and acting lessons.

origin_dialogue: If you can get Bonita to take the stage again, then you're the star of my show, kid.
translated_dialogue: If you can get Bonita to take the stage again, then you're the star of my show, kid.

origin_dialogue: Hey, what's this? A new script?
translated_dialogue: Hey, what's this? A new script?

origin_dialogue: "Knight of Joy?"
translated_dialogue: "Knight of Joy?"

origin_dialogue: Weird. It smells like popcorn. And it doesn't say which set to play it on...
translated_dialogue: Weird. It smells like popcorn. And it doesn't say which set to play it on...

origin_dialogue: Oh well. We'll just play it on whatever's on stage. I mean, what could POSSIBLY go wrong?
translated_dialogue: Oh well. We'll just play it on whatever's on stage. I mean, what could POSSIBLY go wrong?

origin_dialogue: Here. You can be my first A.D.
translated_dialogue: Here. You can be my first A.D.

origin_dialogue: Use the megaphone if you want to run the play again.
translated_dialogue: Use the megaphone if you want to run the play again.

origin_dialogue: Okay! New script everybody! Let's practice!
translated_dialogue: Okay! New script everybody! Let's practice!

origin_dialogue: Aaaand action!
translated_dialogue: Aaaand action!

origin_dialogue: Oh, another script!
translated_dialogue: Oh, another script!

origin_dialogue: "The Day the Mail Boat Finally Came."
translated_dialogue: "The Day the Mail Boat Finally Came."

origin_dialogue: Uh-oh.
translated_dialogue: Uh-oh.

origin_dialogue: Prop department? I'm going to need a boat on stage right away.
translated_dialogue: Prop department? I'm going to need a boat on stage right away.

origin_dialogue: Okay, people! Places everyone!
translated_dialogue: Okay, people! Places everyone!

origin_dialogue: "Goodbye Hagatha Home."
translated_dialogue: "Goodbye Hagatha Home."

origin_dialogue: Hey, I--I think this is the one with the--
translated_dialogue: Hey, I--I think this is the one with the--

origin_dialogue: Hey, props. Is that hot air balloon still working?
translated_dialogue: Hey, props. Is that hot air balloon still working?

origin_dialogue: Let's hustle people! It's show time!
translated_dialogue: Let's hustle people! It's show time!

origin_dialogue: That means you too, kid. You gotta hustle onto that balloon if you want to get up to the catwalks.
translated_dialogue: That means you too, kid. You gotta hustle onto that balloon if you want to get up to the catwalks.

origin_dialogue: I have GOT to get control over this production!
translated_dialogue: I have GOT to get control over this production!

origin_dialogue: If only Bonita would come out here and do her thing.
translated_dialogue: If only Bonita would come out here and do her thing.

origin_dialogue: Okay, Becky. Get a grip!
translated_dialogue: Okay, Becky. Get a grip!

origin_dialogue: A-hoo hoo hoo!
translated_dialogue: A-hoo hoo hoo!

origin_dialogue: I am NOT crying.
translated_dialogue: I am NOT crying.

origin_dialogue: God.
translated_dialogue: God.

origin_dialogue: Okay. Okay. Okay.
translated_dialogue: Okay. Okay. Okay.

origin_dialogue: Everything under control there, Becky?
translated_dialogue: Everything under control there, Becky?

origin_dialogue: Everything okay there Becky?
translated_dialogue: Everything okay there Becky?

origin_dialogue: Ah! Why did you say that? What have you heard?
translated_dialogue: Ah! Why did you say that? What have you heard?

origin_dialogue: You get Bonita Soleil to perform again, and everything will be GREAT.
translated_dialogue: You get Bonita Soleil to perform again, and everything will be GREAT.

origin_dialogue: Her dressing room is behind the stage to the right, at the end of the hall.
translated_dialogue: Her dressing room is behind the stage to the right, at the end of the hall.

origin_dialogue: Hey, you said that if Bonita performed, everything would be okay.
translated_dialogue: Hey, you said that if Bonita performed, everything would be okay.

origin_dialogue: Okay, so I left out the part about the deadly Phantom. I thought you'd chicken out!
translated_dialogue: Okay, so I left out the part about the deadly Phantom. I thought you'd chicken out!

origin_dialogue: Ma'am. I'm a Psychonaut. Just show me how to get up to those catwalks he hides out in and--
translated_dialogue: Ma'am. I'm a Psychonaut. Just show me how to get up to those catwalks he hides out in and--

origin_dialogue: Sorry. No way up there.
translated_dialogue: Sorry. No way up there.

origin_dialogue: Well, there was this ONE play...
translated_dialogue: Well, there was this ONE play...

origin_dialogue: We would lower this prop hot air balloon down from the catwalks, and then pull it back up again...
translated_dialogue: We would lower this prop hot air balloon down from the catwalks, and then pull it back up again...

origin_dialogue: But I think one of the actors lost the script somewhere.
translated_dialogue: But I think one of the actors lost the script somewhere.

origin_dialogue: If you find it--or any other play for crying out loud--just bring it to me and I'll run the actors through it.
translated_dialogue: If you find it--or any other play for crying out loud--just bring it to me and I'll run the actors through it.

origin_dialogue: We're so desperate for new material around here!
translated_dialogue: We're so desperate for new material around here!

origin_dialogue: So how do I get up to the catwalks?
translated_dialogue: So how do I get up to the catwalks?

origin_dialogue: Bring me all the scripts you find, and maybe one of them will bring that hot air balloon down.
translated_dialogue: Bring me all the scripts you find, and maybe one of them will bring that hot air balloon down.

origin_dialogue: ...if you play it on the right set.
translated_dialogue: ...if you play it on the right set.

origin_dialogue: Those catwalks sucked. Why did I ever want to go up there?
translated_dialogue: Those catwalks sucked. Why did I ever want to go up there?

origin_dialogue: To fight the Phantom and save the theater?
translated_dialogue: To fight the Phantom and save the theater?

origin_dialogue: Oh yeah!
translated_dialogue: Oh yeah!

origin_dialogue: Becky, can we see the "Knight of Joy" again?
translated_dialogue: Becky, can we see the "Knight of Joy" again?

origin_dialogue: Yeah, that one could use a little work.
translated_dialogue: Yeah, that one could use a little work.

origin_dialogue: "The Day the Mail Boat Finally Came" needs another run-through, I think.
translated_dialogue: "The Day the Mail Boat Finally Came" needs another run-through, I think.

origin_dialogue: Let's do "Goodbye Hagatha Home" once more, okay?
translated_dialogue: Let's do "Goodbye Hagatha Home" once more, okay?

origin_dialogue: Doing a great job, Becky!
translated_dialogue: Doing a great job, Becky!

origin_dialogue: Aw!
translated_dialogue: Aw!

origin_dialogue: Hey, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, CAREFUL!
translated_dialogue: Hey, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, CAREFUL!

origin_dialogue: That's the manual mood override. That's how we set the right mood for the play.
translated_dialogue: That's the manual mood override. That's how we set the right mood for the play.

origin_dialogue: Mess with that, we'll have happy plays on sad sets, sad plays on happy sets
translated_dialogue: Mess with that, we'll have happy plays on sad sets, sad plays on happy sets

origin_dialogue: Total chaos. Or worse--IMPROV.
translated_dialogue: Total chaos. Or worse--IMPROV.

origin_dialogue: So whatever you do...
translated_dialogue: So whatever you do...

origin_dialogue: Don't mess with the manual mood override unless you want to see some strange stuff happen!
translated_dialogue: Don't mess with the manual mood override unless you want to see some strange stuff happen!

origin_dialogue: Oh, who would have thought that I, Gloria Von Gouton, would be starring in my own Broadway musical at such a young age?
translated_dialogue: Oh, who would have thought that I, Gloria Von Gouton, would be starring in my own Broadway musical at such a young age?

origin_dialogue: I hope my mother is proud of me. Well, here it goes!
translated_dialogue: I hope my mother is proud of me. Well, here it goes!

origin_dialogue: Oh, my dear Mother! Do you not love my new seaside mansion, bought with a fraction of the wealth my overnight success has given to me?
translated_dialogue: Oh, my dear Mother! Do you not love my new seaside mansion, bought with a fraction of the wealth my overnight success has given to me?

origin_dialogue: Yes, Gloria, my daughter. I only live to make you happy.
translated_dialogue: Yes, Gloria, my daughter. I only live to make you happy.

origin_dialogue: We are so lucky to be together again so that I could share it all with you, and also that you are not even jealous of my youth and fame, though my star has risen so much faster and grown so much bigger than that of yours, which has so quickly faded!
translated_dialogue: We are so lucky to be together again so that I could share it all with you, and also that you are not even jealous of my youth and fame, though my star has risen so much faster and grown so much bigger than that of yours, which has so quickly faded!

origin_dialogue: Yes.
translated_dialogue: Yes.

origin_dialogue: I love sharing my wealth and fame with you dear mother.
translated_dialogue: I love sharing my wealth and fame with you dear mother.

origin_dialogue: Yes. And I am so glad that you remember that you owe it all to me.
translated_dialogue: Yes. And I am so glad that you remember that you owe it all to me.

origin_dialogue: Goodbye my previously dear mother! I flee now to Europe to escape your insane jealousy over my amazing career.
translated_dialogue: Goodbye my previously dear mother! I flee now to Europe to escape your insane jealousy over my amazing career.

origin_dialogue: Please do not leave me, Gloria my daughter! Go now and I shall do something unto myself both drastic and traumatizing to you emotionally!
translated_dialogue: Please do not leave me, Gloria my daughter! Go now and I shall do something unto myself both drastic and traumatizing to you emotionally!

origin_dialogue: Care, I do not, for you sicken me with disgust. Adieu, ma mère. Adieu.
translated_dialogue: Care, I do not, for you sicken me with disgust. Adieu, ma mère. Adieu.

origin_dialogue: Daughter please do not run off to Europe to escape my jealous wrath, or I will surely kill unto myself to the death.
translated_dialogue: Daughter please do not run off to Europe to escape my jealous wrath, or I will surely kill unto myself to the death.

origin_dialogue: Break a leg, mother!
translated_dialogue: Break a leg, mother!
